msContents.summary: This manuscript contains the whole text of a commentary on <title xml:lang="ta">Amalaṉ Āti Pirāṉ</title> by <persName xml:lang="ta">Periyavāccāṉ Piḷḷai</persName> and a fragment of <persName xml:lang="ta">Aḻakiya Perumāḷ Nāyaṉār</persName>'s commentary on the same root text.

msItem.colophon:
<pb n="16r"/><lb n="2"/>tiruppāṇiyāḻvār tiruvaṭikaḷē caṟaṇam | ṉayiṉār tiruvaṭikaḷē caṟaṇam | jīyar tiruvaṭikaḷē caṟaṇam | appaṉ tiruvaṭikaḷē caṟaṇam | <lb n="16v"/> <lb n="1"/><term xml:lang="sa">duṃdubhi varṣaṃ</term> paṅkuṉi <term xml:lang="sa">uttaraṃ</term> paurṇamiyileḻutiṉatu tirunārāyaṇapurattile.
<pb n="17r"/> <lb n="1"/><note xml:lang="en">in the middle of the folio</note><term xml:lang="sa">śrīma<sic>dva</sic>dhūlakulavāridhipūrṇacaṃdraṃ(?)śrīmadvarapradagurūttamaputraratnaṃ <lb n="2"/>śrīśailadeśika kṛpātta samastavidyaṃ śrīraṃgadeśikam ahaṃ śaraṇaṃ prapadye</term> <note xml:lang="en">There is an <term xml:lang="ta">Ācārya</term> lineage by the name of <term xml:lang="ta">Kōyil Kantāṭai vādhūla Appaṉ Svāmi Tirumāḷīkai</term> at <term xml:lang="ta">Śrī Persumpūtūr</term>. Those <term xml:lang="ta">Svāmi</term>s are usually called <term xml:lang="ta">Appaṉ Svāmi</term>. May be them.</note>
